      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void annotationsMove()
      Linked annotations are re-anchored when words are clumped.
      void avoidGaps()  
      void basicClumping()
      Basic clumping: punctuation except underscore is attached to adjacent words.
      void childrenMove()
      Child annotations are moved to new parents when clumping occurs.
      void clumpAcrossAnnotations()
      Clumping across annotations at the end of a line.
      void dontClumpAcrossLines()
      Clumping works only within utterances.
      static void main​(String[] args)  
      void nonBMPUnicode()
      Non-letter characters that are not punctuation are counted as orthographic characters, including emoji, kaomoji, stylized letters, etc.
      void nonLatin()
      Non-latin characters are counted as orthographic characters.
      void parentheses()
      Opening parentheses clump with next rather than previous word.

    • Method Detail

      • basicClumping

        public void basicClumping()
        Basic clumping: punctuation except underscore is attached to adjacent words.

      • parentheses

        public void parentheses()
        Opening parentheses clump with next rather than previous word. This is so parentheses can be used by the likes of PatternTagger to accurately tag words/phrases that are parenthesised

      • dontClumpAcrossLines

        public void dontClumpAcrossLines()
        Clumping works only within utterances.

      • clumpAcrossAnnotations

        public void clumpAcrossAnnotations()
        Clumping across annotations at the end of a line.

      • childrenMove

        public void childrenMove()
        Child annotations are moved to new parents when clumping occurs.

      • annotationsMove

        public void annotationsMove()
        Linked annotations are re-anchored when words are clumped.

      • avoidGaps

        public void avoidGaps()

      • nonLatin

        public void nonLatin()
        Non-latin characters are counted as orthographic characters.

      • nonBMPUnicode

        public void nonBMPUnicode()
        Non-letter characters that are not punctuation are counted as orthographic characters, including emoji, kaomoji, stylized letters, etc.

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] args)
